metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5420 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
A "javascript:" url loaded by a malicious page can obfuscate its locationby blanking the URL displayed in the addressbar, allowing for an attackerto spoof an existing page without the malicious page's address beingdisplayed correctly. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 52.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5420` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 52.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 52.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 52.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 52.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '52.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
